CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 4, 1954, pg. 1 reads: "Board Of Judges - These are the judges who made the selections in Carnation Milk Baby Contest. They include two Negro doctors who examined the children for points of physical perfection, the Pittsburgh District sales manager of Carnation Milk Company, the head of the placement department of the Family and Children's Service Agency of the Community Chest, and a famous Negro mother, Mrs. William Eckstein.  Left to right: Dr. Roosevelt Richardson of Homewood; Mrs. Lucille Sparks of Family and Children's Service; John Ruffing Jr., Carnation Milk Company's Pittsburgh District sales manager; Mrs. William Eckstein, mother of the famous "Mr. B," stage screen, radio and television singer, and Dr. James Stewart of Homewood."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of contest judges, from left: Dr. Roosevelt Richardson, Lucille Sparks, John Ruffing Jr., Mrs. William Eckstein, and Dr. James Stewart, posed in Centre Avenue YMCA during Carnation Milk Baby Contest
